accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Costa Rican Subject Collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.p: Reports, serial issues,articles, pamphlets, leaflets, flyers, bumper stickers, sample ballots, campaign biographies, voter's guide and election code. Arranged alphabetically by subject.
Posters, manifesto, sample ballots, election literature and promotional items.

dsc.head: Container List
dsc.p: See card catalog for increments that may have been received after December 1994.

did.unittitle: General. Serial issues, pamphlets, leaflets, flyers, bumper stickers, sample ballot, campaign biographies and reports, largely concerning political parties and campaigns, 1968-1986. Includes material from the Partido Comunista de Costa Rica, Partido Socialista Costarricense, Partido Vanguardia Popular, Movimiento Revolucionario del Pueblo and student movements

Central America. Reports and pamphlets relating to Costa Rica's role in the Central American peace process, arms trafficking and the political situation in Nicaragua. Includes documentary material concerning various peace plans, including that of the Contadora group
Elections, 1990. Voter's guide, election code, sample ballot, bumper sticker, flyers, pamphlets and leaflets, 1989-1990

Trade unions. Newspaper, report and pamphlets concerning labor organizations and strike activities, 1979-1986. Includes material from the Asociacion Nacional de Empleados Publicos (ANEP) and the Confederacion Unitaria de Trabajadores (CUT)

United States. Articles and reports mainly concerning the activities of John Hull within Costa Rica in support of the Nicaraguan Contras, 1988-1993. Includes material on the controversy surrounding allegations made against Hull and the Central Intelligence Agency by the Christic Institute
Posters, manifesto, sample ballots, election literature and promotional items. Includes material from La Liga Antifascista de Costa Rica and the Partido Socialista Costarricense
